intro: Holderlinia, commonly known as the "false larkspur," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Boraginaceae. It consists of about 20 species, primarily native to southern Africa. These plants are typically herbaceous, with hairy stems and showy, blue to purple flowers. They often grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Holderlinia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
